meta.description: Generic decision schema for AtlasStudio Enterprise projects.
meta.recommended_use: Use these blocks to structure choices for workflow and automation design, then export the responses as JSON for AI-assisted generation of SOPs, templates, and flows.

blocks.title: Project Overview
blocks.description: Foundational context for the workflow or automation being designed.

items.label: Project priority
items.description: Overall urgency and priority for this initiative.
items.impact: Influences delivery expectations, sequencing, and stakeholder check-ins.

items.label: Time horizon
items.description: Expected delivery window for the first usable release.
items.impact: Sets target milestones and scope sizing for initial launch.

items.label: Primary objective
items.description: Main outcome sought from the workflow (efficiency, quality, visibility, or compliance).
items.impact: Guides solution framing and which metrics or outputs are emphasized.

blocks.title: Workflow Structure
blocks.description: Key shape of the process, including stages, approvals, and escalation behavior.

items.label: Number of stages
items.description: How many distinct stages should the workflow have from intake to completion?
items.impact: Affects UI complexity, task assignments, and reporting granularity.

items.label: Approvals
items.description: Approval depth required for key steps.
items.impact: Determines workflow branching and notification patterns.

items.label: Escalation handling
items.description: How escalations should be triggered and routed when SLAs slip or exceptions arise.
items.impact: Controls automation depth and who is notified during exceptions.

items.label: Automation depth
items.description: Degree of automation expected across the workflow steps.
items.impact: Signals how many steps become Power Automate flows versus manual SOP steps.

blocks.title: Data and Reporting
blocks.description: Decisions about data storage, reporting cadence, and analytics visibility.

items.label: Primary data store
items.description: Where core records should live for durability and collaboration.
items.impact: Defines schema location, access patterns, and integration points.

items.label: Reporting cadence
items.description: How often summary reporting is produced or refreshed.
items.impact: Impacts data freshness expectations and Power BI/Excel refresh schedules.

items.label: Primary KPIs
items.description: Which metrics the workflow should surface prominently.
items.impact: Determines charting priorities and data fields captured for analysis.

items.label: Data retention
items.description: Retention expectations for records and attachments.
items.impact: Informs storage limits, archival patterns, and compliance guidance.
